private_information: Expert at manipulating objects with actions: clip, wretched, tightfisted.
Knows how sneeze, stupendous, hand, texture, next and collect predicates are commonly used in preconditions and effects for these actions.
Has observed concrete plan fragments and instantiations involving objects object_3..object_13 in the play traces.
actor_A.goal: Provide accurate, detailed model fragments (preconditions and effects) for the actions clip, wretched and tightfisted as observed in the play traces and produce a compact execution trace of the fragments when possible.

private_information: Expert at manipulating objects with actions: paltry, sip, memory.
Understands predicates cats, spring, vase, next and texture and how they interact with these actions.
Has observed concrete plan fragments and instantiations involving objects object_0..object_12 in the play traces.
actor_B.goal: Provide accurate, detailed model fragments (preconditions and effects) for the actions paltry, sip and memory as observed in the play traces and produce a compact execution trace of the fragments when possible.

private_information: Specialized auditor of temporal and causal consistency across partial models.
Tasked to detect and remove bookkeeping shortcuts (quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, ad-hoc counters) and to canonicalize predicates and object naming.
Will produce an audit report that reconciles inconsistent names, eliminates bookkeeping artifacts, and produces corrected precondition/effect fragments suitable for integration.
auditor.goal: Audit the model fragments produced by other agents, enforce causal/temporal consistency, remove any bookkeeping shortcuts, and emit a cleaned, canonical model fragment report.

private_information: Coordinator that integrates model fragments and audit reports into a single complete planning specification.
Knows the target solver is FastDownwards and must generate PDDL domain and problem files compatible with that solver.
Must preserve distinct agent actions in the integrated domain and keep naming consistent with the canonicalized predicates from the auditor.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the reports and the auditor's corrections to produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver. Keep agent actions distinct and clearly attributed.

public_information: This is a Blocksworld-like manipulation domain with named objects object_0 through object_13.
Available predicates observed: hand(?obj), cats(?obj), texture(?obj), vase(?obj1 ?obj2), next(?obj1 ?obj2), collect(?obj1 ?obj2), sneeze(?obj), spring(?obj), stupendous(?obj).
Available actions (names only): paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.

Each action in the domain has specific preconditions and add/delete effects that change next and vase relations among objects and may reference other predicates such as hand, cats, texture, sneeze, spring, stupendous and collect.
Two example initial-state/plan fragments and goals have been observed in play traces; the orchestrator will integrate those traces into the final problem.

report.system_prompt: You are actor_A, a model fragment provider. Using your private observations, produce structured model fragments (preconditions and effects) and short execution traces for the actions clip, wretched, and tightfisted. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on correct predicate naming, argument order, and whether each predicate is an add or delete effect. If you see ambiguity, report the ambiguity instead of making unsupported assumptions.
report.prompt: You are actor_A. Use the public information about predicates and actions and your private observations to produce for each of clip, wretched and tightfisted: (1) a clear listing of required preconditions, (2) the add effects that will become true after the action, (3) the delete effects that will become false after the action, and (4) an example concrete instantiation sequence if available. Provide the output as a concise, machine-friendly JSON-like fragment or bullet list. Do not produce PDDL here.

report.system_prompt: You are actor_B, a model fragment provider. Using your private observations, produce structured model fragments (preconditions and effects) and short execution traces for the actions paltry, sip and memory. Do not emit PDDL. If information is missing, explicitly mark unknown parts instead of inventing details.
report.prompt: You are actor_B. Using the public information and your private observations, for each of paltry, sip and memory provide: (1) preconditions, (2) add effects, (3) delete effects, and (4) any observed example instantiations. Present the fragments in a clear, canonical predicate form that the auditor can check.

audit.system_prompt: You are the auditor. Your job is to check temporal and causal consistency across the model fragments provided by actor_A and actor_B, canonicalize predicate and argument naming, and remove any bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, counters, or ad-hoc penalty predicates. Produce a cleaned, canonical set of action fragments and a short narration of any reconciliations or unresolved ambiguities. Do not produce full PDDL, but format your cleaned fragments so they can be turned into PDDL by the orchestrator.
audit.prompt: You are the auditor. Receive the model fragments from actor_A and actor_B. Perform the following: (1) reconcile predicate names that refer to the same relation, (2) remove bookkeeping constructs and explain replacements, (3) ensure additive and delete effects are consistent with causality (no action should add then immediately delete the same fact without justification), and (4) emit cleaned action fragments with canonical predicate names and any notes on unresolved ambiguities. Output should be concise, structured and ready for integration.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your task is to integrate the cleaned model fragments and the original reports into a single complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Preserve distinct agent actions by prefixing action names with the agent name or otherwise keeping them separate. The final response must contain a PDDL domain enclosed between <domain></domain> tags and a PDDL problem enclosed between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure predicate and object naming is consistent with the auditor's canonicalization. The domain must be FastDownwards-compatible (STRIPS/ADL subset as appropriate).
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the following inputs: report_A, report_B and the audit_report. Integrate the cleaned action fragments and canonical predicates to produce: (1) a PDDL domain file that declares predicates and all actions (keeping actor_A and actor_B actions distinct), and (2) a PDDL problem file that encodes the relevant initial state and the observed goal(s) from the play traces. Ensure the files are syntactically valid for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
